info.title: Permitting & Licensing API
info.description:
The OpenGov Permitting & Licensing API provides programmatic access to Permitting & Licensing data and workflows. With this API, you can integrate with other systems, build custom applications, or automate tasks. 

The API is designed around REST principles, supports JSON:API standards, and exposes resources such as records, inspections, fees, approvals, and user accounts. This documentation covers available endpoints, request and response formats, and error codes, helping developers extend and integrate OpenGov Permitting & Licensing securely and efficiently.

tags.name: Record
tags.description: A Record represents a single permit or license application, code enforcement case, or business process in OpenGov Permitting & Licensing. Records are created in the Employee Portal and/or Citizen Portal and serve as the central container for all related information. This includes form data, workflows, inspections, fees, approvals, public contacts (such as applicants and guests), and associated locations.

tags.name: Approval Steps
tags.description: Approval Steps are one step type that can be found in a record's workflow.

tags.name: Checklist Results
tags.description: Inspection Results include Checklist Results for any checklist item that was inspected.

tags.name: Checklist Templates
tags.description: A Checklist Template is a single item in an Inspection Type Template's checklist.

tags.name: Departments
tags.description: A Department is a group of Record Types.

tags.name: Document Steps
tags.description: Document Steps are one step type that can be found in a record's workflow.

tags.name: Fees
tags.description: A Payment Step can have one or more Fees.

tags.name: Files
tags.description:
Files in OpenGov Permitting & Licensing are managed in a two-step process:

1. **File Upload**
   - First, create a file entry to receive a pre-signed Azure Blob Storage URL
   - Use this URL to upload your file directly to Azure Blob Storage
   - The file is now stored but not yet associated with any entity

2. **File Association**
   - Associate the uploaded file with an entity (currently only Record Attachments)
   - The file is cloned when associated, allowing the same file to be reused across different entities
   - Each association creates a new file object with its own lifecycle

This design allows for efficient file reuse while maintaining independent file management for each entity.

tags.name: Inspection Events
tags.description: An Inspection Event is a single inspection appointment, during which one or more Inspection Results are typically created.

tags.name: Inspection Results
tags.description: An Inspection Result is created for each Inspection Type inspected during an Inspection Event.

tags.name: Inspection Steps
tags.description: Inspection Steps are one step type that can be found in a record's workflow.

tags.name: Inspection Type Templates
tags.description: Inspection Type Templates can be added to Inspection Workflow Step Templates.

tags.name: Inspection Types
tags.description: An Inspection Record Workflow Step has one or more Inspection Types.

tags.name: Ledger Entries
tags.description: A Leger Entry is created for each Fee paid or refunded in a Transaction.

tags.name: Location Flags
tags.description: Location Flags can be added to individual Locations to tag them with certain characteristics.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: A Location can be added as the Primary Location or an Additional Location of a Record. A Location can be a Point, Segment, or Parcel.

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: The Organization represents the entity as a whole.

tags.name: Payment Steps
tags.description: Payment Steps are one step type that can be found in a record's workflow.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Project APIs allow you to work with projects that group related records

tags.name: Record Additional Locations
tags.description:
A Record can be associated with up to 99 Additional Locations.

Record Locations reference Locations.

tags.name: Record Applicant
tags.description: The Applicant is the public user who submitted a Record and/or the primary public contact for the Record.

tags.name: Record Attachments
tags.description: A Record can have attachments which either reference a Record Type Attachment or are ad-hoc. Each attachment can have one or more versions.

tags.name: Record Change Requests
tags.description: A Record Change Request represents a request from an employee to the applicant for changes to the form or attachments.

tags.name: Record Forms
tags.description:
A Record's Form is based on its Record Type.

A Form is comprised of Fields which are contained within Sections. Each Field is of a specific data Type, and has a Label and a Value.

tags.name: Record Guests
tags.description:
Record Guests are additional users who need visibility into the permit/license process. This could include
contractors, architects, property owners, or other stakeholders who need to track the application's progress,
receive updates, or help manage the application. For example, a homeowner (Applicant) might add their
contractor (Guest) to a building permit to help upload revised plans or respond to inspector comments.

A record can have up to 10 Guests. The Applicant or any employee user can add Guests to a Record.

tags.name: Record Primary Location
tags.description:
A Record can be associated with one Primary Location.

Record Locations reference Locations.

tags.name: Record Type Attachments
tags.description: Record Type Attachments are templates that define the required and optional Attachments for a Record of a particular Record Type.

tags.name: Record Type Document Templates
tags.description: Record Type Document Templates provide the format and content of a particular document that should be issued in a Document Step.

tags.name: Record Type Fees
tags.description: Record Type Fees define the calculation structure for individual Fees charged on Payment Steps.

tags.name: Record Type Form
tags.description: The Record Type Form is the form template for records of that Record Type.

tags.name: Record Type Workflow
tags.description: The Record Type Workflow is the workflow template for records of that Record Type.

tags.name: Record Types
tags.description: A Record Type defines the configuration for individual Records of that Record Type.

tags.name: Record Workflow Step Comments
tags.description: Step Comments APIs allow you to retrieve, add or remove comments on workflow steps of a record.

tags.name: Record Workflow Steps
tags.description:
A Record's Workflow is represented as a collection of **Steps**. Steps are automatically created on a Record at the time it is submitted, based on the Record Type Workflow defined for that Record's Type.

Steps are instantiated on Records and can be added or deleted on individual Records, so a given Record's Steps may not always match its Workflow Template.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: A Transaction represents an individual payment or refund transaction on a Record.

tags.name: User Flags
tags.description: User Flags can be added to individual Users to tag them with certain characteristics.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Users can be attached to Records as the Applicant or as a Guest.

tags.name: Activity Logs
tags.description: Activity Log APIs allow you to retrieve historical changes and actions performed on entities in the system. Activity logs track create, update, soft delete, and hard delete operations. Employee access required.

post.description:
Creates a new file entry and returns a pre-signed URL for uploading.

##### Upload Process
1. Call this endpoint with the file metadata to receive:
   - A `fileID` for referencing the file
   - A pre-signed URL for uploading
2. Use the pre-signed URL to upload your file:
   - Send a `PUT` request to the URL
   - Include the file content in the request body
   - Set the `Content-Type` header to match the file type
   - Include the header `x-ms-blob-type` with the value `BlockBlob`
3. Once uploaded, the file can be associated with entities:
   - Currently supports association with [Record Attachments](operation:external/plce-api/plce-api.oas/record-attachments/addRecordAttachment)
   - Each association creates a clone of the original file
   - The same file can be reused across multiple entities

The pre-signed URL expires after 1 hour.

For more information on uploading files, see the [Azure Blob Service REST API documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/put-blob)

### Permissions Required
`File Write`

parameters.description: The Content-Type header must be set to `application/vnd.api+json` for all PUT, PATCH, and POST requests.

id.description: Unique internal ID of the file

fileDate.description: Date when the file was created/uploaded

uploadedByUserID.description: ID of the user who uploaded the file

containerName.description: Name of the container where the file is stored

lastUpdatedByUserID.description: ID of the user who last updated the file

lastUpdatedDate.description: Date when the file was last updated

blobName.description: Name of the blob in storage

uploadUrl.description: Pre-signed URL for uploading the file (valid for 1 hour). Will be null when retrieving files in a list.

urlExpiresAt.description: Expiration timestamp for the pre-signed URL. Will be null when retrieving files in a list.

get.description:
Returns file information including a pre-signed Azure Blob Storage URL for downloading.

get.description:
Retrieve an inspection event by ID.
### Permissions Required
`Workflow Read`

status.description: The status of the inspection event

inspectionScheduleType.description: Specifies how the inspection time is scheduled. `Date` indicates any time on the given startAt date. `DateTime` indicates a specific time on the given startAt date. `Range` indicates within a defined time window. May be null if the schedule service was used, or it was inspected without being scheduled. `AMPM` is a legacy scheduling type that indicates a specific time window within a day.

startAt.description: When the inspection should start. If inspection schedule type is `Date`, this is a speciifc day. If inspection schedule type is `DateTime`, this is a specific time on that day. If inspection schedule type is `Range`, this is the start of the range.

endAt.description: When the inspection should end. If inspection schedule type is `Date` or `DateTime`, this field may be null. If inspection schedule type is `Range`, this is the end of the range.

inspectionStartedAt.description: Timestamp of when the inspection was started. Not to be confused with the `startAt` attribute.

inspectionCompletedAt.description: Timestamp of when the inspection was completed, if status is `Complete`. Not to be confused with the `endAt` attribute.

items.description: List of time slots requested by the applicant for the inspection. Each entry represents a preferred time window with its scheduling type.

scheduledType.description: Specifies how the inspection time is scheduled

requestedStart.description: The requested start time for the inspection

requestedEnd.description: The requested end time for the inspection

isEnabled.description: Whether the inspection event is enabled

note.description: Notes and comments about the inspection
note.example: Initial foundation inspection for building permit BP-2024-001

sequenceNo.description: The order of the event in the series

updatedAt.description: Last updated date

get.description:
Retrieve ledger entries that match the specified filters.
### Permissions Required
`Payment Read`

parameters.name: page[size]

parameters.name: filter[transactionDate]
parameters.description:
Filter by transaction date range.

Supports filter[transactionDate][gte] and/or filter[transactionDate][lte] (ISO-8601 datetimes).

Range is inclusive of both bounds.

If only one bound is provided, filter on that bound only.

If gte > lte, return 400 invalid_parameter.

gte.description: Greater than or equal to this date-time (inclusive)

lte.description: Less than or equal to this date-time (inclusive)

applyAccess.description: Access level required to apply for this record type.

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the record type is enabled.

applicant.description: Indicates whether an applicant is required.

location.description: Indicates whether a location is required.

offlinePayments.description: Indicates whether offline payments are allowed.

viewAccess.description: Access level required to view this record type.

allowProjects.description: Indicates whether this record type can be associated with projects.

htmlcontent.description: HTML content for the record type's public portal page.
htmlcontent.example: Submit your building permit application here. Please ensure all required documents are attached.

status.description: Status of the record type.

renews.description: Indicates whether the record type supports renewals.

orderNo.description: Ordering number for sorting record types.

adHocAttachmentViewAccess.description: Access level required to view ad hoc attachments.

clonedDate.description: Timestamp when the record type was cloned.

parentRecordTypeID.description: Identifier of the source of the cloned record type if applicable.

allowPointLocations.description: Indicates whether point locations are allowed.

allowAddressLocations.description: Indicates whether address-based locations are allowed.

allowSegmentLocations.description: Indicates whether segment-based locations are allowed.

maxLocations.description: Maximum number of locations allowed for this record type.

pointLocationsHelpText.example: Select a specific point on the map for your permit location

addressLocationsHelpText.example: Enter the full address where the work will be performed

segmentLocationsHelpText.example: Draw a line segment to indicate the area of work

allowAdditionalLocations.description: Indicates whether additional locations are allowed.

automaticExpirationDateExtension.description: Indicates whether expiration date extensions are automatic.

automaticProjectRecordsExpirationDateExt.description: Indicates whether project record expiration date extensions are automatic.

disableRecordAttachments.description: Indicates whether record attachments are disabled.

createdAt.description: Date and time (UTC) when the resource was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time (UTC) when the resource was last updated.

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created this resource.

updatedBy.description: ID of the user who last updated this resource.

get.summary: List workflow step templates for a record type
get.description:
Retrieve a list of workflow step templates configured for the specified Record Type.
### Permissions Required
`Record Type Read`

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page

label.description: Short descriptive label for the workflow step.

stepType.description: A value that indicates the kind of process that this step represents

orderNo.description: Ordering number for sorting steps within a workflow.

sequence.description: Indicates whether the step happens in sequence or in parallel.

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the workflow step is enabled.

lastUpdatedByUserID.description: Identifier of the user who last updated the workflow step.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update.

autoAssign.description: Indicates whether the step is automatically assigned to a user or group.

publicCanRequest.description: Indicates whether the public can request inspections.

helpText.description: Additional help text or instructions related to the workflow step.
helpText.example: Please ensure all required documents are submitted before requesting plan review

isRenewal.description: Indicates whether this workflow step is related to a renewal process.

deadlineDays.description: Number of days until the step deadline.

deadlineAutoCompletes.description: Indicates whether the step is automatically completed when the deadline is reached.

deadlineAlerts.description: Indicates whether alerts are sent for approaching deadlines.

deadlineType.description: Identifier for the type of deadline associated with this step.

deadlineEnabled.description: Indicates whether deadlines are enabled for this step.

post.description:
Associates a previously uploaded file with a record as an attachment.

##### Process
1. First, upload your file using the Files API:
   - Use [POST /files](operation:external/plce-api/plce-api.oas/files/createFileUpload) to get a pre-signed upload URL
   - Upload your file using the pre-signed URL
   - Keep the returned `fileID` for the next step
2. Then use this endpoint to create the record attachment:
   - Provide the fileID to associate the file
   - The file will be cloned, creating an independent copy for this record

##### Attachment Types and Versioning
Attachments can be either ad-hoc or template-based:

Using attachmentID:
- Creates a new version of any existing attachment (ad-hoc or template-based)
- The new file replaces the current version
- Previous versions remain accessible in the attachment history

Using attachmentTemplateID:
- Associates the attachment with a specific template
- If no attachment exists for this template, creates a new one
- If an attachment already exists for this template, updates it with a new version
- Takes precedence over attachmentID if both are provided

### Permissions Required
`Record Write`

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Content-Type header must be set to `application/vnd.api+json` for all PUT, PATCH, and POST requests.

fileID.description: ID of the previously uploaded file

name.description: Name of the attachment. If not provided, the file name will be used.

description.example: Detailed structural engineering drawings for the main building foundation and framework

attachmentID.description:
Optional. When provided, creates a new version of an existing attachment.
- Can be used with both ad-hoc attachments and template-based attachments
- The new file will replace the current version
- Previous versions remain accessible in the attachment history

attachmentTemplateID.description:
Optional. When provided, associates the attachment with a template.
- If no attachment exists for this template on the record, creates a new one
- If an attachment already exists for this template, updates it with a new version
- Takes precedence over attachmentID if both are provided

Location.description: URL of the newly created resource

name.description: Name of the attachment

description.example: Detailed floor plan showing room layouts and dimensions

attachmentTemplateID.description: The ID of the attachment template. If null the attachment is considered adhoc and not associated with any type of record configuration.

required.description: If the attachment is required at time of record submission.

orderNumber.description: Represents the order that the attachment will appear when viewing the record.

url.description: Signed Url that is acessible for 24 hours.

createdAt.description: Date and time (UTC) when the resource was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time (UTC) when the resource was last updated.

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created this resource.

get.description:
Forms APIs require the latest version of Forms
Forms APIs are available only on the latest version of Forms, currently in limited release. A 500 error may indicate the community isn't yet on this version. During the limited release, administrators should contact OpenGov to enable access.
Retrieve the form data for a specific record. This returns single-entry form data only. For multi-entry form data, use Form Collection endpoints. ### Permissions Required `Record Read`

id.description: An ID that uniquely identifies a form field

label.description: Short description of the form field
label.example: I agree to the terms and conditions

required.description: Indicates if a field is a required field

internal.description: When true, indicates that the field is visible only to employees otherwise visible to all

ordinal.description: Position of the field within a section or field group

sectionID.description: Indentifier for the section of the form that this field is part of

items.title: Form Collection
items.description:
Form data collection for a record.
This is referred to as a multi-entry section in the UI.
It is used to collect repeatable data from multiple entries.

The related *entries* are referred to as *items* in the UI.
Each entry is a collection of form fields.
Each entry must be retrieved or updated individually.

get.description:
List workflow steps on a record.
### Permissions Required
`Workflow Read`

items.title: Record Workflow Step
items.description:
A record step represents a step in a workflow of a record.

Overview:
- The record step object contains information about the step, including its label, type, and status
- It maintains relationships with other objects like comments and workflow steps
- Each step is associated with a specific Task type that is created upon step activation

Task Relationship:
- The Task type is determined by the step type (e.g., an APPROVAL step creates an ApprovalTask)
- Tasks contain their own information (label, status) and maintain a relationship back to their step
- Each Task type has distinct schemas, API operations, and lifecycles
- Tasks can be either manual (completed by users) or automated (completed by systems)

Completion Rules:
A step cannot be marked as complete until its corresponding Task is completed.

label.description: Short text that describes the workflow step

stepType.description: A value that indicates the kind of process that this step represents

ordinal.description: Order in which the steps are activated in the workflow

status.description: Status of the workflow step

id.description: ID of the related resource

patch.description:
Update a record workflow step's properties.
### Permissions Required
`Workflow Write`

parameters.name: stepID
parameters.description: ID of a workflow step on a record

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Content-Type header must be set to `application/vnd.api+json` for all PUT, PATCH, and POST requests.

label.description: Short text that describes the workflow step

status.description: Status of the workflow step

ordinal.description: Order in which the steps are activated in the workflow

data.title: Record Workflow Step
data.description:
A record step represents a step in a workflow of a record.

Overview:
- The record step object contains information about the step, including its label, type, and status
- It maintains relationships with other objects like comments and workflow steps
- Each step is associated with a specific Task type that is created upon step activation

Task Relationship:
- The Task type is determined by the step type (e.g., an APPROVAL step creates an ApprovalTask)
- Tasks contain their own information (label, status) and maintain a relationship back to their step
- Each Task type has distinct schemas, API operations, and lifecycles
- Tasks can be either manual (completed by users) or automated (completed by systems)

Completion Rules:
A step cannot be marked as complete until its corresponding Task is completed.

label.description: Short text that describes the workflow step

stepType.description: A value that indicates the kind of process that this step represents

ordinal.description: Order in which the steps are activated in the workflow

status.description: Status of the workflow step

id.description: ID of the related resource

get.description:
Retrieve a list of payment transactions that match the specified filters.
### Permissions Required
`Payment Read`

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page

parameters.name: filter[processedByUserID]
parameters.description: Filter by processed by user ID

parameters.name: filter[transactionDate]
parameters.description:
Filter by transaction date range.

Supports filter[transactionDate][gte] and/or filter[transactionDate][lte] (ISO-8601 datetimes).

Range is inclusive of both bounds.

If only one bound is provided, filter on that bound only.

If gte > lte, return 400 invalid_parameter.

gte.description: Greater than or equal to this date-time (inclusive)

lte.description: Less than or equal to this date-time (inclusive)

id.description: Unique internal ID of a transaction

transactionID.description: Unique identifier for the transaction in payment provider

transactionDate.description: Date and time when the transaction occurred

note.description: Additional notes related to the payment

processingFee.description: Processing fee associated with the payment

void.description: Indicates whether the payment has been voided

originalPaymentID.description: Reference to the original payment if this is a refund or adjustment

processedByUserID.description: Identifier of the user who processed the payment

userID.description: Identifier of the user making the payment

destinationPaymentID.description: Identifier for the destination payment in case of fund transfers

checkNumber.description: Check number if the payment was made by check

communityPaidTransactionFee.description: Indicates whether the community paid the transaction fee

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the payment was last updated

payoutDate.description: Date and time when the payout occurred

links.description: Links to related resources in a collection

totalRecords.description: Total count of records across all pages

This endpoint requires employee access.

### Permissions Required
`Activity Log Read`

gte.description: Greater than or equal to the specified timestamp

parameters.description: Filter by user ID who performed the activity

parameters.name: filter[entityTypeId]
parameters.description: Filter by entity type ID (e.g., Records, Attachments, Record_Steps)

parameters.description: Filter by record type name (for record-related activities)

parameters.name: filter[recordNumber]
parameters.description: Filter by record number (for record-related activities)

parameters.description: Cursor for the current page (opaque string returned from previous response)

parameters.description: Number of records to return per page. (Default: 20)

items.title: Activity Log
items.description: An activity log entry represents a change or action performed on an entity in the system. Activity logs track create, update, soft delete, and hard delete operations across various entity types.

id.description: Unique identifier of the activity, represented as {entityTypeId}|{entityId}|{timestamp|idempotenceKey}

entityTypeId.description: Entity type identifier (e.g., Records, Attachments, Record_Steps)

entityKey.description: Key parameter of the entity (e.g., RecordNumber, AttachmentID)

timestamp.description: Date and time (UTC) when the activity occurred

operation.description: Type of operation performed on the entity

operationName.description: Extended description of the operation/action performed

updatedBy.description: Information about who initiated this activity

updatedById.description: ID of the user who performed the action

updatedByName.description: Name of the user who performed the action

recordTypeName.description: Name of the record type (for record-related activities)

items.title: Activity Log Field Value
items.description: Represents a field value change in an activity log entry. Shows the old and new values for a specific field that was modified.

id.description: Unique identifier for this field value change

fieldName.description: Name of the field that changed

tracked.description: Indicates if this field is tracked in the activity log configuration

oldValue.description: Previous value of the field before the change

newValue.description: New value of the field after the change

oneOf.title: Activity Log Entity
oneOf.description: Represents an entity in the activity log system. Entities are tracked objects that can have activities recorded against them.

id.description: Entity identifier, usually consists of {entityTypeId}|{entityId}

entityTypeId.description: Entity type identifier (e.g., Records, Attachments, Record_Steps)

name.description: Human-readable name of the entity

lastUpdatedInfo.description: Information about when and by whom the entity was last updated

updatedAt.description: Date and time (UTC) when the entity was last updated

updatedBy.description: Information about who last updated the entity

updatedById.description: ID of the user who last updated the entity

updatedByName.description: Name of the user who last updated the entity

overflown.description: Indicates when not all activities fit inside the entity model

bearerAuth.description:
The OpenGov Permitting & Licensing API is authenticated using the OAuth2 Client Credentials flow. Access tokens are provided as a bearer token Authorization header in all API requests.
To obtain an access token, you must have an OpenGov-provided Client ID and Client Secret.
Access tokens are obtained by making a POST request to `https://accounts.viewpointcloud.com/oauth/token`
